RelatedSentence: Once fairly obscure , the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force has gotten headlines in recent years by questioning the value of mammograms for women in their 40 s and recommending that men not have the prostate - specific antigen ( PSA ) test unless they have already been diagnosed with prostate cancer .

Last month , the task force drew a very different kind of rebuke , and this time , it came from what amounts to a peer group .

Medicare directed its own high - level committee to examine the task forces December 2013 recommendation that many current and former heavy smokers ages 55 to 80 should get high - tech scans annually for lung cancer .

RelatedSentence: After reviewing the scientific research available to the task force , Medicares Evidence Development & Coverage Advisory Committee in effect rejected the recommendation , concluding that such widespread ( and potentially costly ) screening could lead to more harm than good .
